did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Horticulture and Landscape Architecture Correspondence, Reports
did.abstract: Correspondence and Reports from the Horticulture and Landscape Architecture Department 1959-1983.

bioghist.p: Three instructional horticulture greenhouses were built on Wilson Road in 1951, between what would become Ensminger Pavilion and the future site of Lighty Hall. The greenhouses were torn down in 2007, and the two-thirds acre site was designated as a Display Garden at the behest of University President V. Lane Rawlins and under the guidance of landscape architecture professor Phil Waite. Design and building of the garden began in 2008 and continued thereafter through class projects in various landscape architecture courses.

scopecontent.p: Washington state Potato commission material. The collection includes correspondence and reports. Annual report booklets and binders are included. Faculty correspondence and files are included. International program files are in this collection.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
All boxes contain reports and administrative material related to the Departments of Horticulture and Landscape Architecture.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Horticulture and Landscape Architecture Correspondence, Reports, 1959-1983 (UA1987-25)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Bonnie (last name unrecorded) of Horticulture and Landscape Architecture on July 15, 1987 and retained as UA1987-25.

separatedmaterial.p: One copy of newsletter "Top of Cider Barrel" separated out.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
